title: Lila - An Inquiry into Morals by - Robert M.  Pirsig - Chapter 27
description: A bloody encounter , plus things look quite different at a distance.

transcript_parts.text: hi there i'm going to read chapter 27 of
lila and inquiring to morals by robert m
persig
in the dream he thought someone was
shooting at him and then he realized
this was no dream
someone was pounding on the boat hall
okay he shouted just a minute
it must be the marina attendant wanting
to get paid or something
he got up and in his pajamas slid the
hatch cover open
it was someone he didn't know
he was black with a big grin on his face
and a white tunic that was so bright and
clean it knocked out everything else
he looked like he just stepped off in
uncle ben's rice package
first mate jameson reporting for duty
sir he said and snapped a smart salute
still grinning the tunic had big shiny
brass buttons
fidres wondered where he had found
something like that
he seemed to be grinning at his own
ludicrousness what do you want fidra
said
i'm here to start working
you've got the wrong boat no i ain't you
just don't know me in this uniform
where's lyla he said
peter suddenly recognized him he was
jamie the one he had met in the bar
she's still sleeping peter said sleeping
jamie threw his head back and left man
you can't let her get away with that
it's past 10 in the morning
jamie pointed to his gold wrist watch
time to get her up his voice was very
loud
feeders noticed a head from another boat
was watching them
jamie started to laugh again then looked
up and down the boat with a smile
well you sure had me fooled the way lila
told it this boat was at least five
times this big
and all you got is this peewee little
thing he glanced twice at feeders to
check the reaction to this
that's all right that's all right it's
plenty big enough for me it's just lila
had me fooled
feeders tried to shake the cobwebs out
of his head what the hell was this all
about what did lila tell you he asked
lila told me to come here for work this
morning so here i am
that's crazy pedra said she told you
wrong
the grin disappeared from jamie's face
he looked puzzled hurt then he said
i think i gotta have a little talk with
her and stepped aboard
the way he jumped over the lifeline
showed he was no sailor no permission
dirty street shoes on
feeders was about to call him on the
dirty shoes but then suddenly he saw
richard rogell coming down the dock
raquel waved at him and came over where
did he come from
i'm going down to talk to her jamie said
feeder shook his head she's tired
jamie shook his head back no offense he
said but you don't know about lyla
no she's tired
no man she always talks like that i know
how to fix that
jimmy went down the hatchway
we'll be right up he said
peter started to feel alarmed
he saw that raquel was staring at him he
said to raquel i didn't know you were
here
i've been here for a while raquel said
who is that
some friend of lila's is she still here
she's in trouble he looked up at raquel
she's really in trouble raquel squinted
he looked as though he was going to say
something but then he didn't
finally he said
what are you going to do about it
i don't know peter said i just woke up i
haven't got anything in mind yet
before raquel could answer they heard a
low deep noise below then a shout then a
scuffling sound and then another shout
suddenly jaime's face appeared his white
uncle ben jacket had a big spot of blood
by one of the buttons his hand against
his cheek had blood on it that
he shouted
he came out the hatch on the deck
he reached for the hatch rail and
federer saw his cheek had a bloody gash
goddamn i'm gonna kill her
fierce wondered where he could find a
rag to stop the bleeding maybe below
somewhere
leave me off here jb said i'm calling
the police
what happened raquel said
over his shoulder the face of another
boat owner now stared she tried to kill
me
jamie looked at him something in
regale's expression seemed to stop him
jamie stepped over the boat's lifeline
to the dock
he looked at raquel again she did he
said she tried to kill me ragel's
expression didn't change
jamie then turned and walked down the
dock toward the marina office he jerked
his head over his shoulder and looked
back
i'm going to call the police she tried
to kill me she's going to get it
feeders looked up at raquel and the
other man who was still staring i better
go down and see what happened fiedra
said
you better get out of here rigal said
what why i haven't done anything
that doesn't matter ragel said his face
had that same angry look he had at
breakfast in kingston
at the far side of the marina fierce
could see jamie at the marina office
saying something to the people standing
there he was gesticulating waving one
arm holding his face with the other the
man behind raquel started to walk over
there
rogel said i'm going over there too to
see what he's saying he left and feeders
could see
that at the marina office where raquel
was headed some sort of argument was
going on
what was lyla doing now
down below it was ominously quiet
he stepped down the ladder and saw that
the door to the four cabin was shut
feeders went to the door opened it
slowly and saw lila on the bunk her nose
was bleeding in her hand was a pocket
knife the hypnotic look of last night
was all gone the sheet underneath her
had some small blood spots
why did you do it he asked he killed my
baby how
she pointed to the floor below the bunk
feeder saw the doll laying face down on
the floor
he watched her for a moment wanting to
be careful what to say
finally he said shall i pick it up lilo
didn't say anything
he picked up the doll very carefully
using both hands and carefully set it
beside her
this is a bad place lila said
feeder stepped into the head and got a
handful of toilet paper for the
nosebleed and brought it to her let me
see he said
her nose didn't look broken
but she was starting to puff up under
one eye he saw that her hand was
clenched tight on the jackknife
this wasn't a time to talk about it he
heard a wrapping on the hull
when he got up the ladder he saw it was
ragel again he's gone raquel said but
they're upset
some of them want to call the police i
told him you were just leaving it will
be a lot easier if you just left now
what are the police going to do if you
dress says
ragel looked exasperated you can be here
five more seconds or you can be here
five more weeks which do you want
if you just thought about it okay he
said untie the bow line
you'll have to untie yourself what's the
matter with you
aiding and abetting for christ's sake
i've got to face those people after you
leave
feeders looked at him and shook his head
god what a mess he jumped onto the dock
grabbed the electric power cord and
threw it aboard uncleaning the stern
line and threw it aboard too as he went
forward to take off the bowel lines
he saw that people who had gathered at
the office were looking down his way
crazy how rigal had shown up just at
this minute
and he was right as usual
fetus threw the bowel lines aboard and
with his hands on the boat's bow shoved
with all his might to get the heavy hole
clear of the dock
the current was already starting to move
the stern away
then he grabbed a stanchion
and pulled himself aboard
there's an anchorage inside sandy hook
ragel said horseshoe bay it's on the
chart
feeders moved aft smartly over the
tangled lines to get control of the boat
but in the cockpit he saw the key was
out of the engine the boat was out of
control now but for a moment it didn't
matter because the current was carrying
it into the river and away from the dock
he jumped down below opened the key
drawer under the chart table and found
the key
then scampered up again and inserted it
and turned over the engine
this would be a great time for it to
fail it didn't it took hold and he let
it idle for a while
at the dock now 60 or 70 feet away
raquel was talking to some people who
had gathered around him
feeders shifted into gear increased the
throttle and waved to them they didn't
wave back but they were watching him
one of them cupped his hands and shouted
something but the sound of the diesel
was too loud for it to be heard
feeders waved to them and headed out
into the river toward the new jersey
shore
phew
as he looked back over his shoulder he
saw the water of the river
between the boat and the marina become
wider and wider and the figures become
smaller and smaller they seem to
diminish in importance as they
diminished in size
the whole city was starting to take
shape from the perspective of the water
now the marina was sinking back into the
skyline of the city
the green trees of the parkway dominated
it now and the apartments rising above
the parkway dominated the trees
now he could see some large skyscrapers
at the center of the island rising above
the apartments the giant
it gave him an eerie feeling this time
he barely slipped out of its grasp
you
